ğŸ“In Shillong, Meghalaya today, Shri Md Alam Ansari, Deputy Director, DPIIT, and Ms Pratiti S. from Startup India, participated in the Roundtable Interaction on the revision of the Meghalaya Startup Policy. 

Meghalaya has spearheaded regional entrepreneurial development in the northeast of India. Shri Md Ansari addressed key challenges and bottlenecks that the new proposed policy can explore, including innovation opportunities in the manufacturing sector, as India moves from a service led to a product led economy.

The discussion also highlighted the need to enhance the role of key ecosystem stakeholders â€” including incubators, accelerators, and mentorship networks â€” in driving innovation and entrepreneurship across India. ğŸš€

Startup India, DPIIT has signed an MoU with the Indian Venture and Alternate Capital Association (IVCA) to strengthen capital access and governance for startups across India.

As part of this collaboration, IVCA will:
ğŸ’¸ Facilitate funding access through curated investor connects, pitching sessions, and thematic roundtables
ğŸ¤ Provide mentorship and strategic guidance from leading VC/PE fund managers and domain experts

This MoU will help build a more inclusive, well-governed, and capital-ready startup ecosystem across sectors and stages.

IKP Knowledge Park is proud to share that Dr. Vithal K Lakkineni, Ph.D. from the Technology Transfer Office at IKP PRIME was invited to speak at the AICTE Faculty Development Program on Innovation and Entrepreneurship held at Vignan's University (Deemed to be), Guntur, on 25th July 2025. 

Huge congratulations to Sandeep Satheesan CEO - Technology Business Incubator- Vignan, Vigan team Abdul R, Vijaya Ramu Dirisala, Dean,Â Pavan Kumar Kakumanu and Dr. Krishna Harshitha, Dr Kiranmayi Chanduri.
 
The knowledge-sharing session brought together a dynamic group of professors from MBA and BBA institutions. The workshop saw enthusiastic participation and insightful discussions around the innovation ecosystem, the evolving role of educational institutions in nurturing young entrepreneurs, and how faculty members can become effective startup mentors.

The workshop emphasised how faculty in Tier-2 cities can mentor startups from ideation to market. A key focus was on grassroots innovations in AgriTech, nutraceuticals, and food technologies, aligning institutional efforts with community needs. Participants were encouraged to build local innovation ecosystems and foster collaborations with government agencies. 

This workshop reinforced IKP PRIME's commitment to building inclusive innovation ecosystems and strengthened the connection between education, entrepreneurship, and impactful innovation.

Deepanwita Chattopadhyay Bindu Nishal Viswanadham Duppatla Dr. Priyankana Mukherjee Apoorva Bhatnagar Sridhar Ramanathan IKP EDEN Aaqib Jameel Dedeepya Chermala Vishaka Sawan Ranajit Sen Anuradha Barua Sudha Kalyani Bommareddy, Ph.D. Rohika B Rajeswari Sepana Shreyas Kudva

India is entering a new era of biomedical research, and the i3 Summit â€“ à¤µà¤¿à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¶, hosted by Blockchain for Impact (BFI), marked a powerful step forward.

Bringing together leaders from science, industry, and government, the summit spotlighted how collaboration can accelerate translational research and drive healthcare innovation for all.

IKP was proud to be part of this important conversation shaping the future of biomedical innovation in India.

Deepanwita Chattopadhyay, was invited as a panellist to contribute to the panel "Indian Healthcare Innovation & Its Translation â€“ Crossing Chasms & Bridging Gaps", sharing key insights on speeding the journey from research to real-world impact. She was joined by Dr. Sridhar Ramanathan, Dr. Viswanadham Duppatla, and Aaqib Jameel.

With initiatives like the BFI-BIOME Network gaining momentum, we look forward to contributing to a resilient, inclusive, and innovation-driven healthcare ecosystem for India and beyond.

It is a wrap up for the second edition of theÂ BioStartUps Founders & Investors Forum 2025, held onÂ 1st August 2025Â at the CIDCO Convention Centre, Navi Mumbai, Navi Mumbai.

It was wonderfulÂ connecting with biotech entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, angel investors, bioincubators, and government officials.

Experts gathered and deliberated upon current challenges and opportunities facing the biotech startups such as funding, scale up, global collaborations, regulations, IP, gaps between science and business etc.

The event also honoured young leaders in biotechnology and life sciences who are driving transformative breakthroughs through the NextGen Entrepreneur Awards!

See you all next year with another interesting round of discussions where innovation meets opportunity, fostering collaborations and accelerating startup growth in the biotech space.

We extend our heartfelt congratulations to Loopworm, Blackfrog Technologies, and Lamark Biotech - three visionary startups that are reshaping the future of biotech and med-tech in India and beyond!

ğŸ”¬ Loopworm India raised $3.25 million to commercialize their silkworm-based recombinant protein platform - delivering high-yield, sustainable proteins and expanding global markets in animal health and diagnostics.

â„ Blackfrog Technologies secured $1.7 million to scale its intelligent cold-chain systems, transforming precision refrigeration for vaccines, diagnostics, and public health systems.
Link - https://lnkd.in/gZAWHf2G

ğŸ’Š Lamark Biotech raised â‚¹6.5 crore to advance thermostable biologics that eliminate cold-chain dependency, making life-saving drugs like insulin more accessible and affordable in underserved regions.

Each of these startups began their journey with support from BIRACâ€™s schemes - a shining example of how early-stage funding and public-private partnerships can fuel deep-tech breakthroughs with national and global impact.

IIT Mandi Catalyst organized a curated workshop focused on 'Funding Schemes for Startups.' The workshop, skillfully led by Mr. Gaurav P., Associate General Manager at IIT Mandi Catalyst, aimed to empower founders by introducing the funding opportunities provided by IIT Mandi Catalyst.

The session emphasized seed investments, grants, and eligibility criteria tailored to different business phases. Discussions focused on aligning funding needs with growth stages, crafting persuasive proposals, and understanding investor expectations. Gaurav Parulkar's expertise provided startups with actionable insights, highlighting strategic approaches to leverage financial resources effectively for sustainable growth.

ğŸ“¢ Â IIT Mandi Catalyst is pleased to invite applications for the Investment Readiness Program.

Join our Investment Readiness Program, a dynamic initiative designed for startups poised for commercialization and ready to secure investments for expansion. This program serves as a vital bridge between startups and the market, offering invaluable support and guidance to accelerate growth.

Program Highlights:
ğŸ”¹ Craft a compelling pitch tailored for investors.
ğŸ”¹ Benefit from personalized mentorship by industry experts.
ğŸ”¹ Validate the financial viability and growth strategy of your venture.
ğŸ”¹ Showcase your startup to potential investors on Demo Day.
ğŸ”¹ Refine your pitch with feedback from seasoned professionals.

Demo Day:
Cap off your 90-day sprint with Demo Day, where cohort startups gain exclusive access to a curated audience of venture capitalists, angel investors, and grant providers. This is your chance to shine as you pitch your venture to influential stakeholders, paving the way for potential investments and strategic partnerships.

Don't miss this opportunity to propel your startup to new heights. Join our Investment Readiness Program and unlock the resources and connections you need to thrive in the competitive market landscape.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
Impact and Sustainability are among the most exploited words in the development world. But the essence is simple:

Go back to the roots. 

Prioritise soil health, and productivity will naturally follow. Design farm equipment with farmers, for farmersâ€”just like the village blacksmith who used to built with deep understanding and care. Build market linkages that serve their interest, not digital intermediaries. And most importantly, treat farmers as bankable entrepreneurs, not beneficiaries of charity. Real impact is not about disruption. Itâ€™s about trust, dignity, and lasting systems.

The smiles in this picture reflect the joy of reduced drudgery for women farmers. For them, this is impact: the simple dignity of easier work, saved time, and a little less burden on their shoulders.

Cut the Fat, Not the Flow

The development sector is drowning in intermediariesâ€”re-granting agencies, consultants, collectives, and collaboratives.....Too often, they justify their existence with buzzwords like â€œsystems change,â€ â€œcapacity building,â€ â€œecosystem,â€ and â€œplatforms,â€ while delivering little beyond roundtables with the same faces in new venues, glossy reports where fonts change more than the data, flashy websites, feel-good videos (about themselves), feel-sad videos (about communities), and databases no one trusts.

The problem isnâ€™t intermediationâ€”itâ€™s bad intermediation. When done well, intermediaries can aggregate demand, align incentives, allocate capital efficiently, and manage risk. But when they morph into self-reinforcing bureaucracies, they stall progress and drain resources, especially when led by people with no personal stake in the outcome. Low "skin in the game" means leaders enjoy asymmetric rewards without bearing consequences. They are insulated from failure, making them risk-averse and impact-light.

We need to rethink the chain. Funders must back proximate actors directly, invest in real capacity, and shift accountability from process to outcomes. The goal isnâ€™t fewer intermediariesâ€”itâ€™s better ones. The best ones are entrepreneurs. They put their credibility, sweat, and future on the line.
Communities donâ€™t need more gatekeepers. They need partners who deliver.

Learn from CA Arpit Parikh, Director at Professional Multi Financial Services Ltd., as he breaks down financial modelling, investor expectations, and fundraising-ready projections. Read the recap and watch the full YouTube webinar linked in the post.

Link to video - https://lnkd.in/ggVHdbBu

#StartupValuation #FinancialModelling #InvestorReadiness #EarlyStageStartups #VentureStudioEvents

The best startup advice often comes between the slides - in those unscripted moments when successful entrepreneurs share what really happened.

Over the weekend at Ahmedabad University, we witnessed exactly that. Author and entrepreneur Ankur Warikoo sat with aspiring founders and shared the unvarnished truth about purpose, failure, and playing the long game in entrepreneurship.

No sugar-coating. No typical motivational quotes. Just real talk about what it actually takes to build something meaningful.

The energy in the room was electric as young innovators and ecosystem enablers connected over shared challenges and breakthrough moments. These are the conversations that matter - the ones that go beyond pitch decks and funding rounds.

Four incredible startups supported by VentureStudio showcased their innovations:
- CERVICHECK by Pragmatech Healthcare Solutions Pvt. Ltd. by Pragmatech Healthcare Solutions - revolutionizing women's health
- Socal Media - transforming digital engagement
- HasiEco Ventures - building sustainable solutions
- Bijoi | Handloom & Handicraft - preserving traditional crafts with modern innovation

We also celebrated the signing of an MoU with FICCI YFLO Ahmedabad. Huge thanks to Neha Goyal (Chairperson) and Shreyra Siryoya (Jt. Secretary) for making this partnership possible.

Events like these remind me why building an entrepreneurial ecosystem matters. It's not just about funding or mentorship - it's about creating spaces where founders can learn from each other's real experiences.

What's the best unfiltered advice you've received as an entrepreneur? Share below ğŸ‘‡

Hardi Shah Aikya Shetty Palna Patel Ekshika Bhagtani

Weâ€™re excited to announce that iCreate has partnered with BRK Startupbootcamp India Pvt. Ltd. to strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem with a sharp focus on Energy Transition and Clean Energy Innovation.

The partnership was announced during the ProtoQuik Launchpad Demo Day, marking the signing of a Letter of Collaboration between Mr. Avinash Punekar (CEO, iCreate) and Mr. Kamal Bansal (Co-Founder & CEO, BRK Startupbootcamp India Pvt. Ltd.), paving the way for startups to access mentorship, global networks, strategic investments, and best practices to scale faster and create real-world impact. 

#iCreateWithYou #ProtoQuikLaunchpad #StartupbootcampIndia #EnergyTransition #CleanEnergyInnovation #CollaborationForImpact

Avinash Punekar | Siddharth Pareek | Riya Singha | Divyalax Chauhan | Venushree Patel | Dr.Praveen D. | Dr. Sanjeev K Yadav | Dr Guru | Parimal Verma | Anish Chavda | Dr. Raashid Saiyed | Hiiren Y.

Innovation in Action â€“ ProtoQuik Cohort Showcase

Thirty days ago, a group of early-stage startups walked into iCreate with bold ideas and the determination to turn them into reality. Over the course of this intense sprint, they refined their concepts, built working prototypes, and took significant strides toward market readiness.

Today, we witnessed the culmination of that incredible journey at the ProtoQuik Launchpad Demo Day â€“ but this is only the end of the program, not the end of the road. The journey towards commercialisation for these groundbreaking solutions is just beginning.

The atmosphere was electric as ecosystem partners, mentors, government representatives, and industry leaders came together to celebrate innovation, perseverance, and the vision to create solutions that matter.

Over the next few posts, weâ€™ll share the moments that made this Demo Day truly special, as we gear up to welcome many more ProtoQuik cohorts in the coming months, fueling rapid innovation at scale. ğŸŒŸ
